intro: Oldenlandia trothae, commonly known as the velvetleaf or silverleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a velvety appearance. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom during the warmer months. Oldenlandia trothae is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
